post.title: How It Feels To Walk Around Town With a Little Baby

div.p: I dunno, does #Blessed mom really feel blessed? One thing I was not prepared for having kids was how utterly amazing it was to walk around town with a little baby. I consider myself a pretty successful person, but absolutely nothing I've ever done in my life came remotely close to the positive attention of having a baby. No fancy car or diamond necklace can turn heads like a cute six-week-old. Total strangers literally burst into tears in Trader Joe's and told me wistfully about their own grown kids. Nothing has ever made me feel closer to people, or like the world is somehow, fundamentally, a good place like the way it reacted to my newborn. And I have a pretty privileged life overall; if you don't, that feeling must be like mainlining heroin.
